title: KEEN: Redemption - Official Thread
content:
7/08/05-

I've finally begun working on the sequel to my mod, The Last Moon. This game will continue the saga several years into the future as Keen's sister, Becky Blaze, goes off to find what has become of her brother.

So far, I only have two screenshots to offer, and of a test level at that. But this should give you a good idea of what's coming.

This first screenshot is of the beginning of the level. It features such visual items such as trees and grass and water. Hopefully the real levels will be more interesting to look at.
[img]http://www.spatang.com/gnosticus/KEEN101.GIF[/img]

This next part of the level was set up to show some of the collectible items and how they will look with different lighting.

[img]http://www.spatang.com/gnosticus/KEEN103.GIF[/img]

Also, for the billionth time, here's the title screen.

[img]http://www.yossarko.com/wdfaa/img/keensister.gif[/img]-----
[img]http://gnosticus.spatang.com/PBF056BCPuppyWish.jpg[/img]

title: Re: KEEN: Redemption - Official Thread
content: It looks cool![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] [img]http://images.ucomics.com/comics/ga/2005/ga050705.gif[/img]

title: cute!
content:
I like the way you did the silhouetted ground tiles underwater--helps give things a sense of depth.

Who did your main character sprite? (I forget what name you decided on for her. For some reason I think 'Bailey.')

The darkened upper sky seems to put a fine psychological-but-not-physical upper barrier on your levels. :-) If I were playing that mod, I'd probably only go over the top of the building as a last resort...

title: Re: KEEN: Redemption - Official Thread
content:
Also, here's a super-exclusive unfinished version of the game I started. It's only two levels but I thought it was cool. I may keep several of the elements in this for the next version

[url=http://www.spatang.com/gnosticus/CC2unfinished.zip]www.spatang.com/gnosticus...nished.zip[/url]

EDIT: I did the sprite, and I was going to use the name Bailey Blaze, but after I posted a poll a lot more people seemed to like Becky, so I went with that.-----
[img]http://gnosticus.spatang.com/PBF056BCPuppyWish.jpg[/img]

title: woah!
content:
Hahaha--woah. Your first level is very innovative, visually, and excellent difficulty-wise. I was introduced to all sorts of platforms I didn't expect to be able to walk on, backgrounds which were awe-inspiring, and enemies which were intimidating--all without having to worry about an unfair death! Awesome!

Then I hit level two, and never got past the big jump down a stairway of heat tiles. :-( I suck.

I really liked your exit tiles, your Garg replacements, and Becky's shooting sprite. The "I'm in the air" sprite could use a tiny bit of adjustment if you wanted to, but it's good as it is. The Yorp replacements looked similar to your last mod's guys, if memory serves.

Either way, excellent work so far--it looks like you've got a lot of creative ways to fool us into thinking more is happening than not. The elevator blew my mind. Kudos!

title: Re: woah!
content: wow this is really great so far! the elevator is wonderful and art work and sprite design are very nice! good work... btw great title screen! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

title: Allsparkly.
content:
The screenshots look quite promising.. the black outlines give a nice cartoonish feel... combined with your trademark dithery backgrounds, the bricks fading into black and, as Xky pointed out, the silhouetted underwater areas, you've got a nice sense of depth going.

As for the demo... nice work on the installation-themed tiles, and indeed the level design. Making the player literally leap through fire like that is a bit evil--took me about four tries to get that right--but it all feels rather balanced and enjoyable. Also, the elevator concept is ingenious.

Stunning work, as always.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

"This is how liberty dies--with thunderous applause." -Padme

title: Re: w00t!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Who remembers such games as Xargon? Where is the Kiloblaster community?[hr][/quote]Heh, well I've been using Xargon as the 'test' game for my editor...so yes, I certainly remember it (bet you can't remember what the main character's name is, hehehe.)

...and games like Kiloblaster probably lack a community because there wasn't really anything to get involved with - basically it only had one level with varying degrees of difficulty. If Keen was like that I doubt there'd be much of a community either. I think that goes for a lot of games generally - the more interesting the storyline, variety of gameplay, etc. the more likely the game will have a following. One thing that really fascinated me with Keen when I was younger was all the secrets in it that you had to work at to discover. I still find that sort of thing interesting - in many ways, I guess that's why I'm so interested in game editing now, at last I can use an editor to find out *all* the secrets in a game and solve the mysteries once and for all [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
